description: A square temple in a temenos besides the London-Lewes road. Lewis (1966) suggests a construction date around 100 and an end of use in the early 3rd CE.
bibliography: Bird, D, and David Rudling. “Roman-Period Temples and Religion in Roman Surrey.” In Ritual Landscapes of Roman South-East Britain, 2008.
Graham, J. “A Romano-Celtic Temple at Titsey, and the Roman Road.” Surrey Archaeological Collections 44 (1936): 84 ff.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Church Field, Titsey (Surrey).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Rivet, A. L. F. In Town and Country in Roman Britain, 145, 1958.
“Roman Britain in 1935.” Journal of Roman Studies 26 (1936): 262.
“Thursday, December 11th, 1879.” Proceedings of the Society of Antiquaries of London 8 (1881): 213 ff.
